title: Transportation

properties.name: description
properties.value: Transportation includes all of the varied means of getting around the RuneScape realm of Gielinor.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:TransportationThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Transportation

Transportation includes all of the varied means of getting around the RuneScape realm of Gielinor.

Contents

  • 1 Efficient transportation
  • 2 Foot travel
  • 3 Agility shortcuts and obstacles
  • 4 Teleportation
  • 5 Air
  • 6 Carts
  • 7 Water
  • 8 Miscellaneous methods
  • 9 Wilderness

Efficient transportation[edit | edit source]

To get through RuneScape in an efficient manner, you should consider the following things:

  • Train your Agility for faster restoration of run energy.
  • Use weight-reducing gear to run for longer periods.
  • Train your Magic level to unlock teleport spells, or purchase teleport tablets instead.
  • Complete quests to gain access to transportation methods such as spirit trees, fairy rings, gnome gliders and certain spells.
  • When travelling a lot, consider joining world 330, if your house is in Rimmington. Teleport to your house, exit via the portal, and look if there are any high level hosts available. Join their house, and use their installed teleportation methods. If the hosts have maxed out houses, they often also have rejuvenation pools, restoring your run energy. Especially for low-level players, this method opens up an extreme range of teleportation options for the price of just one house teleport.

Foot travel[edit | edit source]

Walking or running is the basic method of travel. A player's Agility level and the amount of weight carried determines how long a player can run. The more weight you carry, the shorter distance you can run. Additionally, pressing the Control key and clicking on a part of the map temporarily turns on run.

Agility shortcuts and obstacles[edit | edit source]

By taking shortcuts, a player is able to reach a destination faster. The higher the Agility level, the more shortcuts are available. There are also obstacles, which are similar to shortcuts, but have one major difference: using these agility obstacles is the only way to get to that certain area.

Teleportation[edit | edit source]

A player teleporting

Teleportation is the instant travel from any location to a specific location elsewhere.

  • Magic, Ancient Magicks, Lunar, and Arceuus teleport spells are a very quick method of getting to specific places.
  • Enchanted jewellery such as ring of dueling and games necklace can be used as teleports.
  • The Pharaoh's sceptre teleports the bearer to any of the three great pyramids: Jalsavrah, Jaleustrophos and Jaldraocht.
  • The Skull sceptre teleports you to Barbarian Village.
  • Spirit trees are used between Tree Gnome Village, Grand Exchange, Tree Gnome Stronghold, and south of Ardougne.
  • Mysterious ruins to rune altars.
  • Wizards (Aubury, Wizard Cromperty ...) to rune essence mines.
  • Ectophial takes you to Port Phasmatys.
  • Camulet takes you to the Enakhra's Temple.
  • A teleport crystal takes you to Lletya.
  • A Dorgesh-kaan sphere will take you to Dorgesh-Kaan, and a Goblin village sphere will take you to Goblin Village.
  • An Enchanted lyre will take you south-west of Rellekka.
  • A Xeric's talisman can teleport you to four locations in Great Kourend, as well as Mount Quidamortem.
  • Both the Kharedst's memoirs and the Book of the dead can teleport you to five locations in the Great Kourend
  • Amulet of glory (charged)
  • Necklace of skills (charged)
  • Combat bracelet (charged)
  • Ring of wealth (charged)
  • Ring of life

Air[edit | edit source]

  • Gnome glider including the military glider. All of the gliders take you to the Grand Tree glider. From the grand tree glider you can take gliders to the Digsite (it will crash when you get there.), Al Kharid, white wolf mountain's peak (combat levels 30 and below beware!), Feldip Hills (The ogre area, accessible only after the One Small Favour quest), Ape Atoll (accessible after Monkey Madness II). Crash Island (accessible after Monkey Madness I) destination only.
  • Magic carpets - the first one is found after exiting Shantay Pass, they will take you to different parts in the desert.
  • Hot air Balloon transport system
  • Eagle transport system

Carts[edit | edit source]

  • Dwarf Mine cart
  • Shilo Village cart system
  • Lovakengj Minecart Network

Water[edit | edit source]

Players can sail by sea between:

  • Port Sarim and Karamja
  • Port Sarim and Entrana
  • Ardougne and Brimhaven and Rimmington
  • Shilo Village to Port Khazard and Port Sarim
  • Rellekka to Miscellania and Etceteria
  • Ogre boat ride Karamja to the Feldip Hills
  • Witchaven to the Fishing Platform and vice versa
  • Crash Island to Ape Atoll
  • Rellekka to Waterbirth Island, Lunar Isle, Jatizso, Neitiznot and Iceberg.
  • Port Sarim to Void Knight Outpost and Crandor
  • Charter ships

By river

  • Canoes
    • Between Deep Wilderness (destination only), Ferox Enclave, Edgeville (Varrock side), Barbarian Village, the Champions' Guild, and Lumbridge

Miscellaneous methods[edit | edit source]

  • Wizards' Guild portals
  • Portal Chamber in a player owned house
  • Mort Myre Swamp
  • Ardougne teleport lever to the Deserted Keep (level 55 Wilderness)
  • The Abyss
  • Wilderness Obelisks
  • Dying - destination Lumbridge, Falador (Requiring completion of Recruitment Drive), Camelot (Requiring completion of Knight Waves Training Grounds), Edgeville (Paying 5 million gp to Krystilia in the Edgeville Jail), Ferox Enclave (Paying 5 million gp to Ferox), or Prifddinas (Requiring completion of Song of the Elves), most or all items lost, full stats.
  • Lovakengj Minecart Network
  • Dorgesh-Kaan–Keldagrim train system
  • Grand seed pod
  • Fairy rings

Wilderness[edit | edit source]

  • Ardougne teleport lever teleports the player into the deep Wilderness - can be used to navigate from Edgeville to Ardougne
  • Wilderness Obelisks teleport players from within the Wilderness to other parts of the Wilderness
rawContent:
{{External|rs|rsc}}
[[File:Transportation logo.png|right|150px]]
'''Transportation''' includes all of the varied means of getting around the ''[[RuneScape]]'' realm of ''[[Gielinor]]''.

==Efficient transportation==
To get through RuneScape in an efficient manner, you should consider the following things:
*Train your [[Agility]] for faster restoration of [[run energy]].
*Use [[weight-reducing gear]] to run for longer periods.
*Train your [[Magic]] level to unlock [[teleport spells]], or purchase [[teleport tablets]] instead.
*Complete quests to gain access to transportation methods such as [[spirit tree]]s, [[fairy ring]]s, [[gnome glider]]s and certain spells.
*When travelling a lot, consider joining world 330, if your [[POH|house]] is in [[Rimmington]]. Teleport to your house, exit via the portal, and look if there are any high level hosts available. Join their house, and use their installed teleportation methods. If the hosts have maxed out houses, they often also have [[rejuvenation pool]]s, restoring your run energy. Especially for low-level players, this method opens up an extreme range of teleportation options for the price of just one house teleport.

==Foot travel==
Walking or running is the basic method of travel. A player's [[Agility]] level and the amount of weight carried determines how long a player can run. The more weight you carry, the shorter distance you can run. Additionally, pressing the Control key and clicking on a part of the map temporarily turns on run.

==Agility shortcuts and obstacles==
By taking shortcuts, a player is able to reach a destination faster. The higher the [[Agility]] level, the more shortcuts are available. There are also obstacles, which are similar to shortcuts, but have one major difference: using these agility obstacles is the only way to get to that certain area.

==Teleportation==
[[File:Teleport.gif|thumb|right|A player teleporting]]
[[Teleportation]] is the instant travel from any location to a specific location elsewhere.
*[[Magic]], [[Ancient Magicks]], [[Lunar spells|Lunar]], and [[Arceuus spellbook|Arceuus]] teleport spells are a very quick method of getting to specific places.
*Enchanted [[jewellery]] such as [[ring of dueling]] and [[games necklace]] can be used as teleports.
*The [[Pharaoh's sceptre]] teleports the bearer to any of the three great pyramids: [[Jalsavrah]], [[Jaleustrophos]] and [[Jaldraocht]].
*The [[Skull sceptre]] teleports you to [[Barbarian Village]].
*[[Spirit tree]]s are used between [[Tree Gnome Village (location)|Tree Gnome Village]], [[Grand Exchange]], [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]], and south of [[Ardougne]].
*Mysterious ruins to rune altars.
*Wizards ([[Aubury]], [[Wizard Cromperty]] ...) to [[rune essence mine]]s.
*[[Ectophial]] takes you to [[Port Phasmatys]].
*[[Camulet]] takes you to the [[Enakhra's Temple]].
*A [[teleport crystal]] takes you to [[Lletya]].
*A [[Dorgesh-kaan sphere]] will take you to [[Dorgesh-Kaan]], and a [[Goblin village sphere]] will take you to [[Goblin Village]].
*An [[Enchanted lyre]] will take you south-west of [[Rellekka]].
*A [[Xeric's talisman]] can teleport you to four locations in [[Great Kourend]], as well as [[Mount Quidamortem]].
*Both the [[Kharedst's memoirs]] and the [[Book of the dead]] can teleport you to five locations in the Great Kourend
*[[Amulet of glory]] (charged)
*[[Necklace of skills]] (charged)
*[[Combat bracelet]] (charged)
*[[Ring of wealth]] (charged)
*[[Ring of life]]

==Air==
*[[Gnome glider]] including the military glider. All of the gliders take you to the Grand Tree glider. From the grand tree glider you can take gliders to the [[Digsite]] (it will crash when you get there.), Al Kharid, white wolf mountain's peak (combat levels 30 and below beware!), [[Feldip Hills]] (The [[ogre]] area, accessible only after the [[One Small Favour]] quest), [[Ape Atoll]] (accessible after [[Monkey Madness II]]). [[Crash Island]] (accessible after [[Monkey Madness I]]) destination only.
*[[Magic carpet]]s - the first one is found after exiting [[Shantay Pass]], they will take you to different parts in the desert.
*Hot air [[Balloon transport system]]
*[[Eagle transport system]]

==Carts==
*Dwarf [[Mine cart]]
*[[Shilo Village cart system]]
*[[Lovakengj Minecart Network]]

==Water==
Players can sail by sea between:
*[[Port Sarim]] and [[Karamja]]
*[[Port Sarim]] and [[Entrana]]
*[[Ardougne]] and [[Brimhaven]] and [[Rimmington]]
*[[Shilo Village (location)|Shilo Village]] to [[Port Khazard]] and [[Port Sarim]]
*[[Rellekka]] to [[Miscellania]] and [[Etceteria]]
*[[Ogre boat ride]] [[Karamja]] to the [[Feldip Hills]]
*[[Witchaven]] to the [[Fishing Platform]] and vice versa
*[[Crash Island]] to [[Ape Atoll]]
*[[Rellekka]] to [[Waterbirth Island]], [[Lunar Isle]], [[Jatizso]], [[Neitiznot]] and [[Iceberg]].
*[[Port Sarim]] to [[Void Knight Outpost]] and [[Crandor]]
*[[Charter ship]]s
By river
*[[Canoe]]s
**Between [[Wilderness|Deep Wilderness]] (destination only), [[Ferox Enclave]], [[Edgeville]] ([[Varrock]] side), [[Barbarian Village]], the [[Champions' Guild]], and [[Lumbridge]]

==Miscellaneous methods==
*[[Wizards' Guild]] portals
*[[Portal Chamber]] in a [[player owned house]]
*[[Mort Myre Swamp]]
*[[Ardougne teleport lever]] to the Deserted Keep (level 55 Wilderness)
*The [[Abyss]]
*[[Wilderness Obelisk]]s
*[[Death|Dying]] - destination [[Lumbridge]], [[Falador]] (Requiring completion of [[Recruitment Drive]]), [[Camelot]] (Requiring completion of [[Knight Waves Training Grounds]]), [[Edgeville]] (Paying 5 million gp to [[Krystilia]] in the Edgeville Jail), [[Ferox Enclave]] (Paying 5 million gp to [[Ferox]]), or [[Prifddinas]] (Requiring completion of [[Song of the Elves]]), most or all items lost, full stats.
*[[Lovakengj Minecart Network]]
*[[Dorgesh-Kaan–Keldagrim train system]]
*[[Grand seed pod]]
*[[Fairy rings]]

==Wilderness==
*[[Ardougne teleport lever]] teleports the player into the deep Wilderness - can be used to navigate from Edgeville to Ardougne
*[[Wilderness Obelisk]]s teleport players from within the Wilderness to other parts of the Wilderness
[[Category:Transportation|*]]
